results.title: Citizen Kane
results.brief_description: Newspaper magnate, Charles Foster Kane is taken from his mother as a boy and made the ward of a rich industrialist. As a result, every well-meaning, tyrannical or self-destructive move he makes for the rest of his life appears in some way to be a reaction to that deeply wounding event.

constellations_other.name: Newsreel to nightly news
constellations_other.description: For decades, newsreel companies covered the news, providing weekly stories of current events, sport, and entertainment to audiences at the cinema, and establishing the format that would be taken up by television and the nightly news.

results.description: Newspaper magnate, Charles Foster Kane is taken from his mother as a boy and made the ward of a rich industrialist. As a result, every well-meaning, tyrannical or self-destructive move he makes for the rest of his life appears in some way to be a reaction to that deeply wounding event.

As a result, every well-meaning, tyrannical or self-destructive move he makes for the rest of his life appears in some way to be a reaction to that deeply wounding event.

results.title: Cinema Paradiso
results.brief_description: A filmmaker recalls his childhood, when he fell in love with the movies at his village’s theater and formed a deep friendship with the theater’s projectionist.
results.description: A filmmaker recalls his childhood, when he fell in love with the movies at his village’s theater and formed a deep friendship with the theater’s projectionist.
description_for_label: A filmmaker recalls his childhood, when he fell in love with the movies at his village’s theater and formed a deep friendship with the theater’s projectionist.

results.title: Cinderella
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Pictures, Genre Films, Beagle Pug Films, Allison Shearmur Productions, Dante Ferretti, Chris Weitz, Sandy Powell, Kenneth Branagh, David Barron and Simon Kinberg
results.headline_credit: United Kingdom and United States of America, 2015
results.brief_description: When her father unexpectedly passes away, young Ella finds herself at the mercy of her cruel stepmother and her daughters. Never one to give up hope, Ella’s fortunes begin to change after meeting a dashing stranger in the woods.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Walt Disney Pictures, Genre Films, Beagle Pug Films, Allison Shearmur Productions, Dante Ferretti, Chris Weitz, Sandy Powell, Kenneth Branagh, David Barron and Simon Kinberg
results.headline_credit_for_label: United Kingdom and United States of America, 2015

results.title: Cinderella
results.creator_credit: Institut für Kulturforschung, Jacob Grimm, Wilhelm Grimm and Lotte Reiniger
results.brief_description: Lotte Reiniger’s interpretation of Grimm’s recorded version of Aschenputtel (Cinderella) from 1922.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Institut für Kulturforschung, Jacob Grimm, Wilhelm Grimm and Lotte Reiniger

results.title: Cinderella
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Pictures, Citadel Entertainment, Storyline Entertainment, BrownHouse Productions, Ellen Mirojnick, Randy Ser and Robert Iscove
results.brief_description: This is the third television version of Rodgers & Hammerstein’s Cinderella; a musical written for television, with music by Richard Rodgers and a book and lyrics by Oscar Hammerstein II.

constellations_other.name: Princesses, rom-coms and sit-coms
constellations_other.description: Newsreel footage was captured on large, bulky 35mm cameras like the Mitchell Newsreel Camera by operators in the field, but they were also used by film production companies and on TV shows, with some of those involved going on to define different genres.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Walt Disney Pictures, Citadel Entertainment, Storyline Entertainment, BrownHouse Productions, Ellen Mirojnick, Randy Ser and Robert Iscove
results.description: This is the third television version of Rodgers & Hammerstein’s Cinderella; a musical written for television, with music by Richard Rodgers and a book and lyrics by Oscar Hammerstein II.This 1997 television remake was adapted by Robert L. Freedman and directed by Robert Iscove, with choreography by Rob Marshall. It was produced by Whitney Houston and Debra Martin Chase for Walt Disney Television and aired on November 2, 1997. Sixty million viewers watched the broadcast. Several songs were added, including “Falling in Love with Love” from the musical The Boys from Syracuse, sung by the Stepmother; “The Sweetest Sounds” from the musical No Strings, sung by Cinderella and the Prince; and “There’s Music in You,” written for the 1953 film Main Street to Broadway, sung as the finale by the Fairy Godmother.
description_for_label: This is the third television version of Rodgers & Hammerstein’s Cinderella; a musical written for television, with music by Richard Rodgers and a book and lyrics by Oscar Hammerstein II.This 1997 television remake was adapted by Robert L. Freedman and directed by Robert Iscove, with choreography by Rob Marshall. It was produced by Whitney Houston and Debra Martin Chase for Walt Disney Television and aired on November 2, 1997. Sixty million viewers watched the broadcast. Several songs were added, including “Falling in Love with Love” from the musical The Boys from Syracuse, sung by the Stepmother; “The Sweetest Sounds” from the musical No Strings, sung by Cinderella and the Prince; and “There’s Music in You,” written for the 1953 film Main Street to Broadway, sung as the finale by the Fairy Godmother.

results.title: Cinderella
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Pictures, Walt Disney Animation Studios, Walt Disney, Ted Sears, Hamilton Luske, Wilfred Jackson, Bill Peet, Ken Anderson, Winston Hibler, Clyde Geronimi, Erdman Penner, Joe Rinaldi, Homer Brightman and Harry Reeves
results.brief_description: Disney’s beloved animated classic tells the rags-to-riches story of a young woman with an awful step-family.

constellations_other.name: Princesses, rom-coms and sit-coms
constellations_other.description: Newsreel footage was captured on large, bulky 35mm cameras like the Mitchell Newsreel Camera by operators in the field, but they were also used by film production companies and on TV shows, with some of those involved going on to define different genres.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Walt Disney Pictures, Walt Disney Animation Studios, Walt Disney, Ted Sears, Hamilton Luske, Wilfred Jackson, Bill Peet, Ken Anderson, Winston Hibler, Clyde Geronimi, Erdman Penner, Joe Rinaldi, Homer Brightman and Harry Reeves
results.description: Cinderella has faith her dreams of a better life will come true. With help from her loyal mice friends and a wave of her Fairy Godmother’s wand, Cinderella’s rags are magically turned into a glorious gown and off she goes to the Royal Ball. But when the clock strikes midnight, the spell is broken, leaving a single glass slipper… the only key to the ultimate fairy-tale ending!
description_for_label: Cinderella has faith her dreams of a better life will come true. With help from her loyal mice friends and a wave of her Fairy Godmother’s wand, Cinderella’s rags are magically turned into a glorious gown and off she goes to the Royal Ball. But when the clock strikes midnight, the spell is broken, leaving a single glass slipper… the only key to the ultimate fairy-tale ending!

results.title: Chronicle of a Summer
results.brief_description: Anthropologist and filmmaker Jean Rouch, along with sociologist and film critic Edgar Morin, both assisted by Marceline and Nadine, roam the crowded streets asking ordinary people how they deal with the misfortunes of life.

constellations_other.name: Film-truth
constellations_other.description: The experimental documentary Man with a Movie Camera has had a lasting impact on the development of film styles.

results.description: Paris, summer of 1960. Anthropologist and filmmaker Jean Rouch, along with sociologist and film critic Edgar Morin, both assisted by Marceline and Nadine, roam the crowded streets asking ordinary people how they deal with the misfortunes of life. Are you happy? But their real purpose is to find out if people can speak sincerely in front of a camera and how they react when they are later invited to analyze the meaning of their answers.
description_for_label: Paris, summer of 1960. Anthropologist and filmmaker Jean Rouch, along with sociologist and film critic Edgar Morin, both assisted by Marceline and Nadine, roam the crowded streets asking ordinary people how they deal with the misfortunes of life. Are you happy? But their real purpose is to find out if people can speak sincerely in front of a camera and how they react when they are later invited to analyze the meaning of their answers.

results.title: Chronicle
results.creator_credit: Dune Entertainment, Davis Entertainment, Adam Schroeder Productions, 20th Century Fox, Max Landis, Josh Trank, John Davis, Stephen Altman, Diana Cilliers, Adam Schroeder and Sergey Muraviev
results.brief_description: Three high school students make an incredible discovery, leading to their developing uncanny powers beyond their understanding. As they learn to control their abilities and use them to their advantage, their lives start to spin out of control, and their darker sides begin to take over.

constellations_other.name: Found footage and the first camcorder
constellations_other.description: Amateur filmmakers turned the camera on their own lives when camcorders like the Sony Betamovie BMC-100P came on the market. The style of footage filmed on camcorders has inspired many fictional films, particularly in the horror genre.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Dune Entertainment, Davis Entertainment, Adam Schroeder Productions, 20th Century Fox, Max Landis, Josh Trank, John Davis, Stephen Altman, Diana Cilliers, Adam Schroeder and Sergey Muraviev
results.description: Three high school students make an incredible discovery, leading to their developing uncanny powers beyond their understanding. As they learn to control their abilities and use them to their advantage, their lives start to spin out of control, and their darker sides begin to take over.

results.title: Chopper
results.creator_credit: Mark Brandon Read, Michele Bennett, Andrew Dominik, Australian Film Finance Corporation, Mushroom Pictures and Pariah Entertainment Group
results.brief_description: The true and intense story of Mark ‘Chopper’ Read, a legendary criminal who wrote his autobiography while serving a jail sentence in prison.

constellations_other.name: Eric Bana
constellations_other.description: There must be something that draws Australian creatives like Eric Bana to darker material as they shoot to stardom overseas. Australia's penal colony past perhaps?

results.creator_credit_for_label: Mark Brandon Read, Michele Bennett, Andrew Dominik, Australian Film Finance Corporation, Mushroom Pictures and Pariah Entertainment Group
results.description: The true and intense story of Mark ‘Chopper’ Read, a legendary criminal who wrote his autobiography while serving a jail sentence in prison.
description_for_label: The true and intense story of Mark ‘Chopper’ Read, a legendary criminal who wrote his autobiography while serving a jail sentence in prison.

results.title: Chitty Chitty Bang Bang
results.brief_description: An eccentric professor invents wacky machinery, but can’t seem to make ends meet. When he invents a revolutionary car, a foreign government becomes interested in it, and resorts to skulduggery to get their hands on it.

constellations_other.name: Like a puppet on a string
constellations_other.description: From the silly to the sinister, puppets, muppets, dummies and toys on-screen.

results.description: An eccentric professor invents wacky machinery, but can’t seem to make ends meet. When he invents a revolutionary car, a foreign government becomes interested in it, and resorts to skulduggery to get their hands on it.
